newsitem.title: CANADA: Toronto stocks close up as golds surge higher.
newsitem.headline: Toronto stocks close up as golds surge higher.

* Toronto stocks climbed to close stronger after an active day, boosted by a surge in heavily weighted golds.
* 96.2 million shares traded valued at C$1.27 billion.
Toronto stocks closed stronger in active dealings on Thursday, as heavily weighted gold issues and a rally in New York pushed the key 300 Index higher.
"Gold stocks were the principle area," said Maison Placements Canada trader Rolie Bradley. "New York was up 43 points, that helped a bit."
Toronto Stock Exchange's key 300 Composite Index rose 15.02 points to close at 5182.10, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average jumped 43.65 points to 5733.47.
Toronto's gold sector gained 1.1 percent.
Trading was active in turnover of 96.2 million shares valued at C$1.27 billion. Advancing stocks out numbered declining ones 483 to 390, with 306 issues unchanged.
Of Toronto's 14 sub-indices, half rose led by golds, forestry products, industrial products and transports. Falling sectors included base metals, retail issues and consumer products.

In related news, the Bank of Canada dropped the key bank rate by 25 basis points to 4.25 percent, a move which prompted Canada's major commercial banks to lower their prime lending rates to 5.75 percent from 6.00 percent.
--- HOT STOCKS ---

* Gold issues dominated Toronto's most actives list. Arequipa Resources Ltd jumped 0.40 to 30.50 on more than 2.3 million shares, aided by more takeover discussion, while Bema Gold Corp gained 0.35 to 11.55.

* Inco Ltd dropped 0.80 to 44.95 after clinching its C$4.3 billion deal with Diamond Fields Resources. It was the first day of trading for Inco's VBN shares, which give investors who accepted the tender offer direct participation in the nickel disovery Voisey's Bay. The new shares closed at 42.95.
-- Lydia Zajc, Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8100
